reviewText:
Fast & Furious Showdown does exactly what the title says; it makes one quickly furious.

Showdown is a terrible game with PS2-like visual quality and the gameplay itself is even worse.
The game consists of 10 chapters; each chapter has at least 1 event, but the later ones might have 4 or 5.

F&F Showdown isn't all about racing, though. Well, technically, it is, but isn't just not about finishing laps. There's some variety in it (killing enemies and carjacking, for example), which fit the movies if you think about it but the execution is terrible and is exactly what you would expect from a mobile game just a few years ago. It's very unpolished.

The AI is either incredibly stupid or 'smart'. There's no inbetween. Checkpoints are very rare and if you do have to restart there's no way to skip the ridiculous intros.

The voice acting is pretty good and the character models do look like the characters from the movies (in a way) but it's not enough to make this a good game.

I was glad I finished it in just a couple of hours. Any longer and I would've thrown my controller into the screen. Avoid.

[Rating: 42/100]

reviewText:
One of the worst games I have had the misfortune of playing. You can't even drive properly without crashing in to a something and remaining stuck on it until the car decides to reset.
With bad mobile kind of graphics, from undynamic enviorments, to terrible controls, to an unusually low draw distance, and a uninspired story. This is a movie tie-in game that fails specatcularly to generate the same spectacle or action from the film itself.

On a scale of 1-10 I'll probably give this one a -356

reviewText: Fast and furious showdown is based on the blockbuster movie series of the same name. But just like the awesome movies will you want to play the game ? In Fast And Furious Showdown you play as many charecters that appeared in the previous movies like Brian, Tej, Han etc. So how is the game ? The game is absolute garbage and the its one of the worst games i have played period. But first for the story. This takes place over the course of 5 and 6 with a bunch scenes explaing what happend in those movies, but the story is so confusing you will walk away more confused that anything. So how is the gameplay ? Its so horrible its not funny. The cars handle like complete ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and its hard to win a race when the car barely goes where you want to. The game is riddled with bugs. In Chapter 4 the game crashed constantly and i had to use a diffrent computer to get past the level. The game also looks like complete garbage. It looks like a very early PS2 game. Overall Fast And Furious Showdown is a mess of a game and im dissapointed that i bought it and i could have saved my money. I give Fast and Furious Showdown a 2/10\n\nFor more reviews follow Snort's Review curator page here - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

reviewText:
This game is utter dissappointment. To be honest I bought it on sale but it should be given out for free. Why?

Graphic: Lets face it. Even Tetris looks better because it is just Tetris. This should be racing game so graphic should be on first play.
Audio: Simpy boring.
Story: Missions are taken from F&F movies but their order is really chaotic (or perhaps it is not but I didn't see any connections between them).

If you are fun of this series try to find it at some decent price (2-3‚Ç¨ at most). But if you don't buy it you won't miss anything.

reviewText: On November 30, 2013, at approximately 3:30 p.m. PST, Walker and Roger Rodas, 38, left an event for Walker's charity Reach Out Worldwide for victims of Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda)[50] in Rodas's red 2005 Porsche Carrera GT. The car crashed into a concrete lamppost and two trees on Hercules Street, in a 45 miles per hour (72 km/h) speed zone near Kelly Johnson Parkway in Valencia, Santa Clarita, California, after which the vehicle burst into flames. The crash was caught on film by a security camera.Authorities determined that Rodas was driving the car, while Walker was the passenger. The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department declared both victims dead at the scene. Rodas died of multiple traumatic injuries, while Walker died from the combined effects of traumatic and thermal trauma, according to the Los Angeles county coroner's office. Both of their bodies were burned beyond recognition.\n\nThe curve where Walker and Rodas were killed is a popular spot for drifting cars.The coroner's report stated that the 2005 Porsche Carrera GT was traveling at a speed possibly as high as 100 miles per hour (160 km/h) before the crash. The coroner's report further stated that no alcohol or other drugs were found in the systems of either man.Furthermore, it states that there were no hints of technical problems with the car and neither a damaged surface of the street nor parts on the street played a role in the accident.Police investigated as to whether drag racing played a role, but were unable to find evidence of a second car's involvement.A piece of the car was stolen off the tow truck as the wreckage was towed away on a flatbed. Two men, Jameson Brooks Witty and Anthony Janow,were arrested for grand theft.Walker's autopsy showed scant soot" in his trachea
